Data Privacy and Security: Collect only data essential for selection purposes.
Ensure compliance with privacy regulations when storing or analyzing applicant data.
Provide applicants the option to request removal of their data ("right to be forgotten").
Use enterprise-grade security for storing or processing applicant data.
Avoid sharing applicant data via personal or unsecured AI tools.
Contractually bind third-party vendors to institutional data protection policies.
Fairness and Bias Mitigation: Avoid using low-quality or unrepresentative data in AI system development.
Conduct annual audits of AI systems to detect and address biases.
Pilot-test AI tools in low-stakes settings before full implementation.
Human Oversight and Transparency: Maintain human judgment in AI-assisted selection processes; avoid full automation.
Do not modify data collection or evaluation methods mid-cycle; ensure consistency.
Disclose the use of AI in selection processes to applicants transparently.
